titleStmt.title: The diseased maiden lover being a pleasant new song, to an excellent new tune, or, may be sung to the tune of, Bonny Nell.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A36136 of text R217282 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing D1668). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

titleStmt.title: The diseased maiden lover being a pleasant new song, to an excellent new tune, or, may be sung to the tune of, Bonny Nell.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright,

notesStmt.note: Place of publication from and date conjectured by Wing.
"The faithless lover. To the same tune" is printed on the same sheet in col. 3-4; woodcuts at head of each ballad.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
